Title: We've Issued Our First IP Address Certificate
Description:
Since Let’s Encrypt started issuing certificates in 2015, people have repeatedly requested the ability to get certificates for IP addresses, an option that only a few certificate authorities have offered. Until now, they’ve had to look elsewhere, because we haven’t provided that feature.
Today, we’ve issued our first certificate for an IP address, as we announced we would in January. As with other new certificate features on our engineering roadmap, we’ll now start gradually rolling out this option to more and more of our subscribers.

Title: ToListAsync is fast again in Entity Framework (kind of)
Description: Last year I wrote an article about how ToListAsync was slow in Entity Framework titled: "Be careful with ToListAsync and ToArrayAsync in Entity Framework Core". Things have evolved since then, so let's celebrate!

Title: Get the location of the ISS using DNS
Description: I love DNS esoterica. Weird little things that you can shove in the global directory to be distributed around the world instantly(ish).  Domain names, like www.example.com usually resolve to servers. As much as we think of "the cloud" as being some intangible morass of ethereal Turing-machines floating in probability space, the more prosaic reality is that they're just boxen in data centres. They …
